alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Dickens; Garza; Kent; Lubbock; Lynn (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 12:29PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Kent, southwestern Dickens, southeastern Lubbock, Lynn, Garza and southern Crosby Counties through 100 PM CDT... At 1228 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Post, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Slaton, Post, Tahoka, Crosbyton, Lake Alan Henry, White River Lake, Ransom Canyon, O`Donnell, Kalgary, Grassland, Justiceburg, Caprock, Southland, Wilson and Buffalo Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Crosby; Dickens; Garza; Kent; Lubbock; Lynn
